content.data:
When you start a new Job in the S2M Optimizer, the main S2M Optimizer 
 window opens. This window is your primary work space. It contains a list 
 of all the Parts that will be sent to your saw. The following illustration 
 shows the main parts of the S2M Optimizer window.

The S2M Optimizer Button replaces the File menu and is located in the 
 upper-left corner of the S2M Optimizer. When you click the S2M Optimizer 
 Button, you see the same basic commands available in earlier releases 
 of the S2M Optimizer to Open, Save, and Print your Job.

The Quick Access Toolbar is a toolbar containing a set of commands that 
 are independent of the ribbonbar tab that is currently displayed.
The Quick Access Toolbar can be located in one of two places:

Upper-left corner next to the S2M Optimizer 
	 Button  (default location)

Upper-left corner next to the S2M Optimizer 
	 Button  (default location)

Upper-left corner next to the S2M Optimizer 
	 Button  (default location)

If you don't want the Quick Access Toolbar to be displayed in its current 
 location, you can move it to the other location. If you find that the 
 default location next to the S2M Optimizer Button   
 is too far from your work area to be convenient, you may want to move 
 it closer to your work area. The location below the ribbonbar encroaches 
 on the work area. Therefore, if you want to maximize the work area, you 
 may want to keep the Quick Access Toolbar in its default location.

Click  Customize Quick 
	 Access Toolbar    . 
 In the list, click  Show 
	 Below the Ribbon .

In the list, click  Show 
	 Below the Ribbon .

In the list, click  Show 
	 Below the Ribbon .

The Titlebar displays the PNC Job you have open as well as the level 
 of the S2M Optimizer you are running.

This section gives quick and easy access to tools specific to the area 
 of the S2M Optimizer you are in. The ribbon will change depending on which 
 area of the S2M Optimizer you are in. Options with small  triangles 
 on the right side have flyouts containing tools that invoke commands related 
 to the first Option shown. Click and hold down the first button to display 
 the flyout.

These buttons hide the S2M Optimizer window, enlarge it to fill the 
 whole screen, and close it, respectively.

Allows you to choose the Style that the S2M Optimizer interface will 
 utilize. There are three choices.

Blue 
	 Style 
 Black 
	 Style 
 Silver 
	 Style - The default Style.

This section gives access to functions specific to the area of the S2M 
 Optimizer you are in. This section will change depending on which area 
 of the S2M Optimizer you are in.

This is the actual working area of the S2M Optimizer. This area's size 
 varies, depending on the size of the S2M Optimizer window and on the number 
 of other elements that are displayed.
This bar contains your software license information.

The Statusbar menu gives you quick access to control the status of 4 
 possible options:

Unit 
	 Selection   or   
	 -  Allows you to toggle between Inches (Imperial) and Metric 
	 Units on the screen. You can turn this button On/Off and set its default 
	 Unit via the  Preferences 
	 | Measurement Units  tab.

Unit 
	 Selection   or   
	 -  Allows you to toggle between Inches (Imperial) and Metric 
	 Units on the screen. You can turn this button On/Off and set its default 
	 Unit via the  Preferences 
	 | Measurement Units  tab.

Unit 
	 Selection   or   
	 -  Allows you to toggle between Inches (Imperial) and Metric 
	 Units on the screen. You can turn this button On/Off and set its default 
	 Unit via the  Preferences 
	 | Measurement Units  tab.

Unit 
	 Precision -  Selecting the Unit Precision option next to the 
	 Unit will allow you to change the Precision of the Unit selected. 
	 The default Unit Precision is set via  S2M Center Button | Preferences | Measurement 
	 Units  tab.

Unit 
	 Precision -  Selecting the Unit Precision option next to the 
	 Unit will allow you to change the Precision of the Unit selected. 
	 The default Unit Precision is set via  S2M Center Button | Preferences | Measurement 
	 Units  tab.

Unit 
	 Precision -  Selecting the Unit Precision option next to the 
	 Unit will allow you to change the Precision of the Unit selected. 
	 The default Unit Precision is set via  S2M Center Button | Preferences | Measurement 
	 Units  tab.

data.text:
S2M Center Button | Preferences | Measurement 
	 Units

content.data:
Snap 
	 Grid   
	 -  This option turns the Grid display on. You will see a grid 
	 pattern in the window where you Edit Part Shapes or Edit Operations 
	 that you can Snap to. If this button is highlighted it means it is 
	 active simply click it again to disable it. Go to  Right 
	 Click Properties  to set the Grid Spacing. 
 Snap 
	 to Points   -  Using this snap feature allows 
	 precise snapping of drawn entities. This option turns on the Dynamic 
	 Snapping functionality in the S2M Optimizer. The snap to points appear 
	 as small dark dots in the corner of the objects and all parts within 
	 the object. These are the snap to points. If these points are present 
	 and not desired, reset the snapping mode to OFF or another mode to 
	 eliminate them. If this button is highlighted it means it is active 
	 simply click it again to disable it.

Snap 
	 Grid   
	 -  This option turns the Grid display on. You will see a grid 
	 pattern in the window where you Edit Part Shapes or Edit Operations 
	 that you can Snap to. If this button is highlighted it means it is 
	 active simply click it again to disable it. Go to  Right 
	 Click Properties  to set the Grid Spacing.
